column4: Anyone know if it would be faster to boot from an SD card or a 5400RPM drive?
try it. I'd rather the 5400rpm drive
compare booting SD card to live install environment compared to an installed OS
it's not actually hanging at the DMI pool
do you get prompted for username / password
where would I find my xinitrc file?
or, do you know how xubuntu starts an xfce session? exec xfce-session ?
I believe the login manager will kick that off, not sure tbh
you still get a logn screen though right?
No, not with my vnc server. Just logs right in to my user with an xfce4 session. I wanted to get it loaded with the xubuntu defaults as it looks nicer.
does it connect to the logged in session then?

Yeah, I've set it so that it logs in to a session as my user automatically. I'm getting what I believe to be gksudo permission issues though. Standard sudo is fine, but any graphical interface like update manager or software center won't actually install anything
not sure there dude. I don't use VNC. I think its vulgar
how would I pass the results of   'dpkg --get-selections | grep firefox'  to   'apt-get purge' ?
